dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news out of China this week, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news out of China this week, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, Alibaba, right? They're under investigation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, Alibaba, right? They're under investigation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: China has launched an investigation into Alibaba for alleged monopolistic practices at the company, dealing yet another blow to the countrys largest tech company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. For what, like, specifically?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. For what, like, specifically?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's this thing called 'er xuan yi,' which, um, basically means they're allegedly forcing merchants to sell exclusively on their platform.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's this thing called 'er xuan yi,' which, um, basically means they're allegedly forcing merchants to sell exclusively on their platform.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The State Administration for Market Regulation said Thursday in a brief post on its website that its investigating Alibabas alleged practice of er xuan yi, which means forcing merchants to sell exclusively on one website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, exclusivity. And, like, their shares plunged, right? Almost eight percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, exclusivity. And, like, their shares plunged, right? Almost eight percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba plunged almost 8% in Hong Kong in the immediate aftermath of the announcement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, immediate aftermath. But Alibaba, uh, they said they'll cooperate, and business operations are 'normal,' you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, immediate aftermath. But Alibaba, uh, they said they'll cooperate, and business operations are 'normal,' you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An Alibaba spokesperson said the company will actively cooperate with the regulators and business operations remain normal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. But this feels like it's part of a bigger picture, doesn't it? Like, all the scrutiny on Jack Ma's companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. But this feels like it's part of a bigger picture, doesn't it? Like, all the scrutiny on Jack Ma's companies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The investigation comes amid heightened scrutiny of businesses co-founded by Chinas one-time richest man Jack Ma.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. I mean, regulators released draft rules last month, giving them a lot more power to, like, rein in these big tech companies. It's all about preventing those exclusive contracts, um, or selling below cost.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. I mean, regulators released draft rules last month, giving them a lot more power to, like, rein in these big tech companies. It's all about preventing those exclusive contracts, um, or selling below cost.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, Chinas policymakers released a set of draft rules that would give regulators wide-ranging power to rein in the market influence of Mas e-commerce titan. Their intention is to prevent Chinas dominant tech companies from forcing merchants to agree to exclusive contracts or selling their products below cost.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just Alibaba, right? What about Ant Group, Jack Ma's other big venture?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just Alibaba, right? What about Ant Group, Jack Ma's other big venture?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, Ant Group is facing huge challenges. Their massive IPO, remember, the thirty-five billion dollar one? `[interrupts]` That was scuttled.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, Ant Group is facing huge challenges. Their massive I P O, remember, the thirty-five billion dollar one? That was scuttled.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the meantime, Mas fintech giant Ant Group is facing big challenges of its own. ... The companys $35 billion initial public offering, which would have been the worlds largest, was scuttled in early November amid sudden changes in the regulatory environment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, man, that was huge news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, man, that was huge news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And now, um, top financial regulators, like the central bank, they're summoning them for another meeting to supervise their compliance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And now, um, top financial regulators, like the central bank, they're summoning them for another meeting to supervise their compliance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Officials from the countrys four top financial regulators that included the countrys central bank, the Peoples Bank of China, and the China Securities Regulatory Commission, said they would soon summon the company to another meeting, according to a report by the official Xinhua News Agency that was published on the same day of the anti-trust probe. Regulators said theyd supervise Ant in terms of the compliance and operation of its finance business, according to Xinhua.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, more pressure there. Ant said they'll comply, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, more pressure there. Ant said they'll comply, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ant said it will seriously study and strictly comply with all regulatory requirements and commit full efforts to fulfill all related work via its official account on Chinese instant messaging service WeChat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they've said they'll 'seriously study and strictly comply.' So, it just feels like this is a really concerted effort, you know, to bring these tech giants, uh, under tighter control in China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they've said they'll 'seriously study and strictly comply.' So, it just feels like this is a really concerted effort, you know, to bring these tech giants, uh, under tighter control in China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ant said it will seriously study and strictly comply with all regulatory requirements and commit full efforts to fulfill all related work via its official account on Chinese instant messaging service WeChat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A massive shift in the landscape, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A massive shift in the landscape, for sure.
